Welcome to Contacts Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The create function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes a ContactModel object as input and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_firstname function takes in a contact_firstname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that first name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Specify the first name of a contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_lastname function takes in a contact_lastname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that last name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Filter the database by last name

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday(db: Session)¶

The get_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next week.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with a birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (Session): A connection to our database, which is used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the database for a specific email address

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first contact in the database whose email matches the given email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on its id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired contact. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify how many contacts to skip before returning the result

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session object to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the information from the body of the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email address is found in the database, otherwise it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object from the database

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object with the new refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.contacts_birthday(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the current month.

The function is called by sending a GET request to /contacts/birthday.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes an email, first_name, last_name and phone number as input parameters. The function returns the newly created contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer as a parameter, which is the ID of the contact to be deleted. It also takes in two dependencies: db and current_user.

  • db is used to access our database session, so that we can make changes to it (in this case deleting).

  • current_user is used for authentication purposes; only users who are logged into their account can delete contacts.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contact_by_firstname function is used to find a contact by their first name.

The function takes in the contact’s first name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Specify the firstname of the contact to be found

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

A contact with the given firstname

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contact_by_lastname function is used to find a contact by their last name.

The function takes in the contact’s last name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Specify the lastname of the contact we want to find

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

A single contact by lastname

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that is passed in the url

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session object

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no contact is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Define the data that will be sent in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is uploaded by the user

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token that contains the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email address, a timestamp, and an expiration date

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user that is stored in the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object if the token is valid

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address from the payload’s sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocess

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on objects of this class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that the user enters

  • hashed_password – Check the password against the hashed version of it

Returns:

True if the password matches, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that they can click on within their browser.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be used in the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine that can be awaited

Doc-author:

Trelent
